meanings.definition: In a manner that is characterized by a high-pitched, chirping sound.
meanings.sent1: The birds chirped tweedily in the early morning.
meanings.sent2: She sang tweedily, mimicking the sound of the birds.
meanings.sent3: The tiny cricket tweedily serenaded the moon.
meanings.sent4: The wind whistled tweedily through the branches of the trees.
meanings.sent5: The teapot whistled tweedily on the stove, signaling it was ready.

meanings.definition: To make a high-pitched, chirping sound.
meanings.sent1: The crickets tweedily outside the window at night.
meanings.sent2: The baby bird tweedily called for its mother from the nest.
meanings.sent3: The old door tweedily complained every time it was opened.
meanings.sent4: The excited children tweedily chattered as they played in the park.
meanings.sent5: The kettle tweedily boiled on the stove, filling the kitchen with steam.
